comments.text:
Created attachment 9076137
esr60_outofdate.png

**Affected versions**
* Firefox 60.8.0esr (20190702220624)

**Affected platforms**
* Windows 10 x64
* macOS 10.14
* Ubuntu 18.04

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Launch Firefox 60.8.0esr and then close it.
2. Open Root Directory of the profile(e.g C:\Users\user\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\qv96l900.profilename) and delete the contents of it.  
3. Open Firefox with the same profile

**Expected result**
* Firefox is opened and no issues are presented.

**Actual result**
* “Your Firefox is out-of-date.” banner is displayed.

**Regression Range**
* I will search for one ASAP.

**Additional Notes**
* Firefox 68.0 (20190704163141), Firefox 69.0b2 Developer Edition (20190704152356), Firefox 69.0a1 (20190704214457) and Firefox 68.0esr (20190704173630) are not affected .
comments.author: alexandru.trif@softvision.com
comments.creator: alexandru.trif@softvision.com

comments.raw_text:
The priority flag is not set for this bug.
:Dolske, could you have a look please?

For more information, please visit [auto_nag documentation](https://wiki.mozilla.org/Release_Management/autonag#workflow.2Fno_priority.py).

I have managed to find the regression manually using Ubuntu 18.04 x64 LTS. The issue occured between esr52.1.1 and esr52.1.2.
Here is the pushlog: `https://hg.mozilla.org/releases/mozilla-esr52/pushloghtml?fromchange=120111e65bc4e9b99da97e9d046765de95fbac8c&tochange=0dc7c28f20648d597b11b60e90be9a15687656aa`.

comments.text:
I have managed to find the regression manually using Ubuntu 18.04 x64 LTS. The issue occured between esr52.1.1 and esr52.1.2.
Here is the pushlog: `https://hg.mozilla.org/releases/mozilla-esr52/pushloghtml?fromchange=120111e65bc4e9b99da97e9d046765de95fbac8c&tochange=0dc7c28f20648d597b11b60e90be9a15687656aa`.
Given that ESR60 is EOL and ESR68 is unaffected per #c0, closing this bug as wontfix.
